senses.de: To decide the result or outcome of something
senses.ex: The judge will determine the course of the trial.

Tips.title: Outcome Influence
Tips.description: Used when your decision directly affects the result of a situation or event.
Tips.example: Your vote will determine the winner of the contest.

Tips.title: Final Verdict
Tips.description: Think of it as making a final choice, especially after careful thought or discussion.
Tips.example: The jury will determine the defendant's fate.

senses.de: To find out facts that will help answer something
senses.ex: Scientists are still determining the effects of the medication.

Tips.title: Investigative Discovery
Tips.description: Refers to a process of questioning, testing, or researching to obtain clear answers.
Tips.example: The detective worked tirelessly to determine the culprit's motive.

Tips.title: Information Gathering
Tips.description: Used when collecting and analyzing data to reach a conclusion.
Tips.example: We conducted surveys to determine market trends.

senses.ex: They determined a place for their meeting.

Tips.title: Precise Decision
Tips.description: Indicates picking an option from possibilities with specific purpose in mind.
Tips.example: You must determine the exact quantity before placing the order.

Tips.title: Exact Fixing
Tips.description: Means to decide on something with precision, leaving no room for doubt.
Tips.example: Please determine the exact location for the new office.

senses.de: To confirm or ascertain something definitely
senses.ex: She finally determined that he was telling the truth.

Tips.title: Proof Verification
Tips.description: Concerns the action of checking facts to come to a confident conclusion.
Tips.example: After examining the evidence, the expert determined that the artifact was genuine.

Tips.title: Certainty Achievement
Tips.description: It points to reaching a state of being certain or assured about something.
Tips.example: He reviewed the document several times to determine its legality.

senses.de: To cause (something) to occur in a particular way or to have a particular nature
senses.ex: Your attitude will determine your success in the project.

Tips.title: Causation Context
Tips.description: Highlights how one factor can cause particular outcomes or consequences.
Tips.example: Poor preparation can determine the likelihood of failure in exams.

Tips.title: Future Shaping
Tips.description: Implies that something will have a significant effect on what is to come.
Tips.example: Her research findings will determine the next steps in combating the disease.

Ascertain.wordDefinition:
The words ascertain and determine have similar meanings, but differ slightly in their usage.

To ascertain means to find out something for certain or make sure of something. For example, you might ascertain the truth of a rumor by checking multiple sources.

Ascertain is used to make sure of something, while determine is used to make a decision or reach a conclusion.

Assay.wordDefinition:
Both assay and determine are used to describe the process of finding out something.

However, assay usually refers to a more specific and detailed test or analysis, often used in scientific or medical contexts.

It can be used in many different contexts, from solving a math problem to deciding on a course of action. Assay is typically used when you need to examine something very closely, like a chemical or a biological sample, whereas determine is used for more general situations where you just need to find out some information.

Conclude.wordDefinition:
Conclude means to arrive at a final decision or judgment based on evidence or reasoning. It is applicable at the end of a thought process or after analyzing information.

For example, "After reviewing all the data, the researchers concluded that there was a significant correlation between exercise and improved mental health."

Conclude is used when making a decision or judgment based on evidence, while determine is used when trying to establish a fact or solution through investigation.

Decide.wordDefinition:
The words decide and determine are similar, but they have a slight difference in meaning. When you decide, you choose between two or more options.

You make a choice that you think is the best one for you. For example, you might decide what to wear, what to eat or what to do over the weekend.

For example, if you want to determine how to save money, you might research different methods, weigh the pros and cons of each, and then decide which one is the best for you.

Decide is used in situations where you have to make a choice, while determine is used in situations where you have to figure out the best course of action based on some kind of analysis or investigation.

Discover.wordDefinition:
Discover means to find something that was previously unknown or hidden.

For example: "The archaeologists discovered an ancient city while excavating in the desert."

Determine is used when we need to make a decision or find a solution, while discover is used when we find something new or unexpected.

Establish.wordDefinition:
Establish refers to the act of creating or setting up a new entity, system, or organization.

It describes the process of initiating or introducing something new. For example, a business may establish a new product line, or a government may establish a new policy.

Determine is used to solve a problem or answer a question, while establish is used to create or introduce something new.

Resolute.wordDefinition:
Resolute means to be firm and unwavering in a decision or action. For example, a resolute person would stick to their decision even in the face of challenges or opposition.

Determine is used when making a decision or arriving at a conclusion while resolute describes someone who is firm in their decision or action.

Resolve.wordDefinition:
Resolve means to find a solution to a problem or conflict. It's applicable when we need to fix something that is not working or causing a problem.

For example, a group of coworkers might resolve a disagreement by talking through the issue and finding a compromise.

Determine is used when we need to figure out or make a decision, while resolve is used when we need to find a solution to a problem or conflict.

quotes.Text: Any fact facing us is not as important as our attitude toward it, for that determines our success or failure. The way you think about a fact may defeat you before you ever do anything about it. You are overcome by the fact because you think you are.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Norman Vincent Peale

quotes.Text: Let us ask ourselves, 'What kind of people do we think we are?' And let us answer, 'Free people, worthy of freedom and determined not only to remain so but to help others gain their freedom as well.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Ronald Reagan

quotes.Text: Your living is determined not so much by what life brings to you as by the attitude you bring to life; not so much by what happens to you as by the way your mind looks at what happens.
quotes.Title: Lebanese Poet
quotes.Name: Khalil Gibran

quotes.Text: Imagine for yourself a character, a model personality, whose example you determine to follow, in private as well as in public.
quotes.Title: Greek Philosopher
quotes.Name: Epictetus

quotes.Text: Choosing to be positive and having a grateful attitude is going to determine how you're going to live your life.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Joel Osteen

quotes.Text: It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it.
quotes.Title: Irish Poet
quotes.Name: Oscar Wilde

quotes.Text: Character is determined more by the lack of certain experiences than by those one has had.
quotes.Title: German Philosopher
quotes.Name: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.Text: The direction in which education starts a man will determine his future in life.
quotes.Title: Greek Philosopher
quotes.Name: Plato

quotes.Text: There is no private life which has not been determined by a wider public life.
quotes.Title: British Author
quotes.Name: George Eliot

quotes.Text: So much of life, it seems to me, is determined by pure randomness.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Sidney Poitier
